reviewText:
I played the game from start to finish, did not try the multiplayer mode. And yet I don't know what the big fuss is about in the reviews... it's that terrible of a game.
Yeah oke the combat sucks, its basically spray and pray, but it does work.
The graphics is dated but it is a low budget game, not every game can be a AAA title.
The story was rather easy to follow, don't know why people can't follow it.

I really liked the setting, steampunk Idea. Steam trains and railguns and steampunk motorcycles were the best.
There was even some good parkour, scaling buildings and walls.
It was not an amazing game but it was worth playing, if you can get it for a good price.

In the end I still enjoyed it, give it a try if you are open minded and not just use to AAA games. 6/10

reviewText:
It is, probably, the lowest scored game I have ever played. No brain killings, dozen of bugs, poor AI, poor weapons, bad voice acting‚Ä¶ and A LOT of things stolen" from Gears of War.

After reading multiple reviews I had thought this is the waste of my money but since there was not so many co-op games I decided to get it.

After few playthroughs I can sadly say that all prejudices were true: few clip offs the map
date: AI is "stupid like Nazis in WW2 movies"
recommended:
and voices‚Ä¶ just horrible. All seems like uglier brother of GoW.

BUT there is something in this game which gets you in. Something which makes you play it over again. Ugly duckling for sure but with good partner and some patience it may become a swan.

Steampunk setting gets into you somehow. Wild west style of cogs
hoursPlayed: blimps and‚Ä¶ steam bikes makes experience unique. If you add to shootings some acrobatics in Lara Croft style
voteText:
you have mix which is not as bad as some write about.

I can forgive this game all the bad because I can have GoW + Tomb Raider + Steampunk.


And I will repeat myself again: steam bikes are just cool."

reviewText:
I have played a lot of Kuso (Garbage) games in the past, and I can in fact tolerate a lot of them, and try to give them a chance. And I do believe some games just get completely unfair treatment from the reviewers and this game seemed to be getting a lot of bad reviews from many websites, so I gave this one a try.

My goodness where do I begin.....

The control. The control is not bad. It is CHEAP. You move around like you are playing some really old PS2 game, and the whole aiming....I. CAN. NOT. AIM. May I ask why??? Even if I did aim at the target correctly, EVERY FRIGGIN GUN IS USELESS!!!!!!! So, there is this gun that appears to be a machine gun. IS IT A TOY GUN??? IT CERTAINLY SHOOTS LIKE ONE?!?!  And DOES IT EVER HIT THE TARGET???? And I can't even tell if I am actually giving any kind of damage to the enemy or not, it's kind of like Resident Evil: Raccoon City, I can't tell if I am seriously hitting them.

And the voice acting....my goodness do they just read or something?

And I have no idea what is up with the story. What's going on? Why does he say that? Why does she say that? Why does this guy appear all of a sudden? When did I get here? Why did I get here? Who are you talking about?? What ARE YOU talking about??!?!?!?!?!!

it just makes me wonder, did the developers even test this game when they made this? Did they think it was ok like this? I mean, the characters move like they have some kind of issues (Or I should say they move like PS2 or old PS1 characters) and the whole combat is not even fun to begin with.

Can I recommend this game? OF COURSE NOT!!!! There are so many better alternatives out there, and why should anyone seriously waste their life time on this? Because certainly, I would NOT want to.

1.4 out of 10.

reviewText: Out of 408 games at the time of writing this, I can still proudly call this the worst purchase I've made on Steam to this day.  I bought Damnation on release day due to hype, and learned a very valuable lesson -- ok, I didn't, I've still bought trash since. A few other titles have put up a hard fight to dethrone Damnation as worst game I've bought on Steam, but Damnation fought them off and still sits proudly as King on a throne of garbage.\n\nAddition:  Plenty of people have gone into what's wrong with the game, so my review doesn't need to repeat after everyone else.  The point of my review is to emphasize how much I regretted the purchase and how much it disappointed me -- so badly that the day of the Steam review system launching (1648 days after buying Damnation), the very first thing I thought to do was find this particular game in my list to give it the biggest thumbs down I could.

reviewText: this game is not great, probably couldn't even consider it good. if you don't mind having no clue where to go and having to explore on your own to find your way, you might like this game. if you prefer figuring out where to go over actual TPS combat, you might like this game. So far, I have liked this game because it is laughably bad in some parts and I have actually gotten a kick out of it because of how bad it is and how hilarious it can be. But it is by no means a good game. It is enjoyable though, and the setting is somewhat unique, it keeps it interesting, despite the awful story. If you can get it for cheap, it might be worth it for a laugh, especially if you play it with a friend in Co-Op. Recommneded for cheaps, for full price no way.

reviewText: Despite the mostly negative feedback from others, I would recommend this game. It still offers a lot of fun for its price and has some surprises. Granted, the main plot is ridiculous, gameplay is very linear, and the cutscenes and any form of conversation between Rourke and his comrades is carried out with far less attention than you can demand for a game released in 2009 - they all behave like robots. Enemy AI is not a big concern. There might be more auto-save points as well because some failures will send you back just a little too far (no, can't save whenever you want).\nBut on the positive side, movement animation in the action is nicely done, the controls are intuitive, and most of the world you are running around in is kind of beautiful (if you like steampunk). There are some nice puzzle situations such as aligning elements redirecting a stream of water to create a consistent flow, and some really fun motorcycle rides. That is not so bad after all.

reviewText:
Graphic wise this does look like a 2009 game. It is fairly ok to look at, at max settings.
But combat wise and mechanics in general this game is way too clunky.

To compare with Half-Life which was released in 1998 for PC, that game is still today better by many times. Just to give a reference of where shooting games should start out from as minimum.

Damnation is sadly way too unpolished a game, which could have been much more with its atmosphere and all. Too bad.

Good thing I only put down 2¬Ω euros for it.

reviewText:
This game is just so bad.
From what I could figure out from the games horrible story narration, you are some captain in a war between PSI and some other guys in a steampunky world. Unfortunatly that is what I managed to hear, everything after the first 2 cutscenes I just skipped, couldn't listen to all those bad voice actors, it sounds like someone just went into recording studio and read the whole script while heavily sedated, but not quite enough to make him unable to read it.

Even though the game concept has some nice ideas such as multi-layer combat, it hasn't been utilised right and it makes the whole fighting experience awful. Developers tried to make a third person shooter/ prince of persia enviorment interaction game which resulted in me wanting to smash the head against the wall. Combat is god awful, from my 38 minute gameplay I noticed that the enemies have more accurate weapons. Trying to use a machine gun resulted in wasting 30 bullets on a single enemy and hitting him maybe 3 times. To be able to actualy kill an enemy with a machine gun you had to be at point blank range and pray to gods he doesn't focus his fire on you.

Apart from bad voice acting and bad combat, there is also badly done character movement. Controls are badly responsive.
Graphics are bad, textures are all glittery almost as if the sun is shining at a wet surface, mind you in this case every surface would be wet and sun would shine from every corner of the level to make it glittery.

To conclude, if you are interested in buying this game, just don't, spend your money on something done right. If you are still not convinced that this is a bad game, I'm sure you can dig up some youtube gameplay videos for the game, try watching those then, maybe then you will change your mind.

reviewText:
bad. just bad.

Feels like the kind of title that would've been great on the PS2, but gameplay has come a long way since then.

If you enjoy games with rigid linear level design, terrible voice acting, wooden, uninspired character animations, cumbersome UI, and awkwardly responsive controls then this is exactly what you're looking for!

For everyone else who likes fun though, avoid this title. It has not aged well

reviewText: This game is more about solving annoying climbing puzzles than shooting stupid enemies, but both climbing and action parts here are sad failure. To tell the truth everything about this game is a failure. The narrative is handled terribly, it's cheap and tasteless. The characters are cardboard and the story is a complete cliche. reviewText:
I knew what was coming and I still got disappointed. Starts with a cutscene that tells little to nothing and looks clumsy. Then you're allowed to get familiar with controls and they sure don't feel nice.

But neat, just a minute of actual gameplay and I'm having a firefight. I'm running forward in order to go to cover but end up getting a few more holes in myself as there are enemies shooting from everywhere around me. k. I'll just go straight to cover on retry and one of my npc friends goes there too. I'm below the window but notice that your character has no ability to shoot from behind cover... and my friend there goes dying and I have to help him up.

After a while of testing which gun would be best, I choose pistol (machine gun couln't hit anything) and kill the first enemy on the right, who also is a parkour master as is jumping all around the place making it harder to shoot him from my already horrible position. I decide to look for more enemies, who I can't see but who don't seem to have trouble shooting me, while still reviving my teammate.

I manage to run to the right side of the stairs and one of the enemies decides that running to the right would make killing him easier. Now pointing my gun at him the game crashes. It just doesn't work even though the computer processes show that it's running fine.

I might actually try playing this through someday, but with all the actually good games out there, this isn't high on my to do list.

reviewText:
Damnation needed more time, and it shows.

Several little but important bits are missing, such as an hit confirmation visual effect (as it is now, an enemy hit by a projectile doesn't even flinch, nor does blood or anything show that you've hit him) or bullets sprites (the machinegun suffers greatly from this. From the sound looks like you're firing a minigun, but just a couple of shots every 2-4 seconds get out of it).

The voice acting is performed by seemingly soulless automatons, who can't bring life to a line even in the most desperate situations. Not that the script in itself is brilliant, mind you - too often the sentences of the various characters seemed disjointed and out of context.

The music is forgettable at best, while the textures are really hideous. The animations are maybe the only reedeming quality of this game, along the climbing sections a-la Assassin's Creed.

The game also tries a shot at good ol' camp, but failing completely. The lines and the story are delivered with a terrible pace and emotionlessly.

For 10 bucks you can really choose a better game to entertain you with.

reviewText: Very strange game to play.  Graphics are so so, but better if you put everything to Intense"
hoursPlayed: and turn V-Sync on (if you have the Graphics power).  Now I've only played about an hour
voteText: and I was a tad confused by the very beginning.  And this isn't a spoiler - the game begins by showing you the end of the American Civil War with a General Prescott being victorious.  Then the General and his troops attack Washington.  Next thing you see is a march of Robot Soldiers and I'm thinking to myself
votesFunny: "How are guns going to stop metal robots?"  Right?\n\nThen this guy comes out carrying a long sword and begins slashing and chopping up soldiers (who are carrying machine guns).  The Swordsman kills all the soldiers (about 8 or so)
column16: swords against machine guns; gimmie a break
column17: the Swordsman would be plowed down immediately."  And I shook my head in disbelief once again.\n\nThen the scene changes
column18: and our  characters come onto the new scene
column21: and destroying Prescott's soldiers.  There was a group of four or five of our guys
column22: then suddenly it's just three - your character
column23: another man and a woman.  It's after that  the tutorial starts.  The tutorial section is very good
column24: much better than some of the other games I've played.  That is one part that I did appreciate.  They show you the keys to use
column25: then give you time to learn the moves
column27: show the move to you by letting another character do it first.  Like I said
column28: that really helped as not many games do that for you.\n\nAs for the targeting system
column29: it's hit or miss.  There's a cross-hair
column30: and if you get it right on the target
column32: that's when you shoot.  But the area of red vs. white is very small.  Most times you'll miss your target.  It takes a steady hand and a healthy body to aim correctly.  Yes
column34: because if you've been hit a few times
column36: making it almost impossible to target your enemy.  It's then you have to find cover to recover.  You can also help your crew if they get hit
column38: but do they restore yours?  Nope.  You do get resurrected a  few times
column40: you're back to your previous save.  I also disliked that sometimes one of your crew just up and disappeared.  One battle I saw the girl get hit a number of times. I knew she was injured and awaiting help because she never made it to the end area - only the two men made it.  The Guy told me what we had to do to advance to the next point
column41: but before I did the action(s)
column42: I went back looking for the girl to heal her - couldn't find her anywhere at all.  So I went back to the end point
column43: and looked to the new starting point.  Guess what?  She was waiting there.  Grrrrr...\n\nAnyway
column45: it is an interesting game to play
column46: but only at the highest graphics settings.  Note that even though it was released on May 22
column48: it was trademarked by Codemaster in 2007 (two years prior).  I think that because of its game mechanics and graphics
column49: it was probably a project that was put away a number of years before that
column50: then one day resurrected when someone was between projects.  It has that kind of a feel to it - bookshelved because it was not so good
column51: and then picked up once again because they needed a project close to completion.\n\nWould I recommend it?  Well
column52: for something to do between great games
column54: this will do.  Plus it will help you appreciate how far gaming has come in the last decade.  So if you can get it for under $5 bucks
column56: think of it just being a day past its expiration date
column57: and add it to your Game Library."

reviewText: Bad bad bad bad bad bad bad. Please do not buy this game. I bought this game as a pre-order because I was caught in the hype of the steam punk large world and dynamic" platforming mechanics. The models are bare bones
recommended: the characters look like lifeless models. fighting is cover based but its implementation is just a poor sorry attempt at copying the gears of war style. The story is incredibly stupid involving people hopped up on drugs being given super powers. The guns pack no punch
hoursPlayed: they feel incredibly dull and so does not work for its playability. The hardest difficulty is only unlockable if you bought a special pre-order edition and the co-op is janky. The large world is a lie. it is just a linear environment and exploration is forced. The AI is incredinly dull  getting stuck in the geometry and having uncanny aim. There are driving segments that are just a joke

reviewText: Bought for a couple of bucks. It was fun at first, but got bored of it real quick. I stopped playing after about 5 hours. I just couldn't get past how bad the fighting was. The graphics were less than good, and the sound effects actually kept making me laugh. Every time someone dies, they make this horrific scream that is just out of place. And before they die, the AI just kind of stands there and shoots, offering no kind of tactical process. I'm not upset that I wasted a couple dollars. I hope the developers can put that money to good use and make something better.

reviewText: Holy sh** where to start with this pile of garbage. Luckily I picked this up for 1 dollar during the summer sale so I feel that I got my money's worth, but damn......The characters are terribly voice acted and by terribly I mean TERRIBLY. The Spanish" ally's accent wavers and disappears
date: all the characters speak in a dead tone deaf droll
voteText: are spoken with borderline no emotion so something that would make me chuckle and roll my eyes turns into something cringe worthy. The "puzzles" if you can call them that are either looking around the drab environment (albeit some areas if you look around are at least interesting to look at....not fun to be in though) for a random ledge to either grab on to or jump off of

The hits are barely noticeable when you land making it easy to waste ammo. assault rifle is useless at mid range which is where it should be good. on "normal" (hardcore in game

reviewText: Man! Does this game have potential. Man! Does this game mess it all up. I love the setting, and the design, and a lot of the artwork and everything. This game has a mind-boggling amount of potential. The main issue is...it's a pretty poor game. The shooting is strange, the animation is laughable, the graphics are pretty poor, and the controls are awkward. So sad. I'd love to see this game get a remake, because it could be an amazing game, if it didn't have so many issues in the gameplay itself.
